discussion.content:
If Excel is not an option, 
OneNote allows users to create multiple notebooks, each with its own sections and pages. You can create a separate notebook for each project, and then create a new page for each travel reservation or itinerary within the appropriate notebook.

Within each page, you can use OneNote's formatting capabilities to organize and track the necessary information, such as flight details, hotel reservations, and rental car information. You can also add tags, links, and attachments to each page as needed.

OneNote also provides the ability to share notebooks with team members, which can be helpful for collaboration and tracking project-related information.

While OneNote may not provide the same level of data management and tracking capabilities as Excel, it can still be an effective solution for tracking travel reservations and itineraries for multiple projects in a single file.
